get.description: Fetches the current market price for a market by `token_id`. Allows historical lookups via the `at_time` query parameter.

parameters.name: at_time
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) to fetch a historical market price.

get.description: Fetches historical candlestick data for a market identified by `condition_id`, over a specified interval.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for start of time range

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for end of time range

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
Interval length: 1 = 1m, 60 = 1h, 1440 = 1d. Defaults to 1m. 

⚠️ **Note:** There are range limits for `interval` — specifically:
- `1` (1m): max range **1 week**
- `60` (1h): max range **1 month**
- `1440` (1d): max range **1 year**

candlesticks.description: Array of market candlestick data, where each element is a tuple containing candlestick data array and token metadata

get.description: Fetches the REALIZED profit and loss (PnL) for a specific wallet address over a specified time range and granularity. Note*: this will differ to what you see on Polymarket's dashboard since Polymarket showcases historical unrealized PnL. This API tracks realized gains only - from either confirmed sells or redeems. We do not realize a gain/loss until a finished market is redeemed.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Defaults to first day of first trade if not provided.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Defaults to the current date if not provided.

message.example: Internal Server Error. Dome Admins contacted.

get.description: Fetches order data with optional filtering by market, condition, token, time range, and user. Returns orders that match either primary or secondary token IDs for markets. At least one of market_slug, condition_id, user, or token_id must be provided. Only one of market_slug, token_id, or condition_id can be provided.

parameters.name: market_slug
parameters.description: Filter orders by market slug

parameters.name: condition_id
parameters.description: Filter orders by condition ID

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: Filter orders by token ID

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Filter orders from this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Filter orders until this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of orders to return (1-1000)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of orders to skip for pagination

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Filter orders by user (wallet address)

shares.description: Raw number of shares purchased (from the blockchain)

shares_normalized.description: Number of shares purchased normalized (this is raw divided by 1000000)

title.example: Will Bitcoin be above $50,000 on July 25, 2025 at 8:00 PM ET?

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the order was placed

total.description: Total number of orders matching the filters

has_more.description: Whether there are more orders available

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters or validation errors

message.example: start_time must be a valid Unix timestamp

value.message: start_time must be a valid Unix timestamp
start_time must be less than end_time
limit must be a number between 1 and 1000
offset must be a non-negative number
At least one of market_slug, condition_id, user, or token_id must be provided
Only one of market_slug, token_id, or condition_id can be provided

get.description: Fetches historical orderbook snapshots for a specific asset (token ID) over a specified time range. Returns snapshots of the order book including bids, asks, and market metadata in order. All timestamps are in milliseconds. Orderbook data has history starting from October 14th, 2025.

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: The token id (asset) for the Polymarket market

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return (default: 100, max: 500)

parameters.name: pagination_key
parameters.description: pagination key to get the next chunk of data

snapshots.description: Array of orderbook snapshots at different points in time

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the snapshot in milliseconds

indexedAt.description: When the snapshot was indexed in milliseconds

pagination_key.description: The pagination key to pass in to get the next chunk of data

has_more.description: Whether there are more snapshots available

message.example: assetId, start_time, and end_time are required

get.description: Find equivalent markets across different prediction market platforms (Polymarket, Kalshi, etc.) for sports events. Provide either one or more Polymarket market slugs or Kalshi event tickers.

parameters.name: polymarket_market_slug
parameters.description: The Polymarket market slug(s) to find matching markets for. To get multiple markets at once, provide the query param multiple times with different slugs. Can not be combined with kalshi_event_ticker.

parameters.name: kalshi_event_ticker
parameters.description: The Kalshi event ticker(s) to find matching markets for. To get multiple markets at once, provide the query param multiple times with different tickers. Can not be combined with polymarket_market_slug.

400.description: Bad Request - Missing or invalid parameters

message.example: At least one polymarket_market_slug or kalshi_event_ticker is required

404.description: Not Found - No matching markets found

message.example: No matching markets found for the provided parameters

parameters.name: sport
parameters.description: The sport to find matching markets for

get.summary: Get Matching Markets for Sports by Sport and Date
get.description: Find equivalent markets across different prediction market platforms (Polymarket, Kalshi, etc.) for sports events by sport and date.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date to find matching markets for in YYYY-MM-DD format

400.description: Bad Request - Missing or invalid parameters

get.description: Fetches market data with optional filtering and search functionality. Supports filtering by market slug, condition ID, or tags, as well as fuzzy search across market titles and descriptions. Returns markets ordered by volume (most popular first) when filters are applied, or by start_time (most recent first) when no filters are provided.

parameters.name: market_slug
parameters.description: Filter markets by market slug(s). Can provide multiple values.

parameters.name: event_slug
parameters.description: Filter markets by event slug(s). Can provide multiple values.

parameters.name: condition_id
parameters.description: Filter markets by condition ID(s). Can provide multiple values.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter markets by tag(s). Can provide multiple values.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter markets by status (whether they're open or closed)

parameters.name: min_volume
parameters.description: Filter markets with total trading volume greater than or equal to this amount (USD)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of markets to return (1-100). Default: 10 for search, 10 for regular queries.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of markets to skip for pagination

title.example: Will Bitcoin be above $50,000 on July 25, 2025 at 8:00 PM ET?

description.example: This market will resolve to Yes if Bitcoin (BTC) is trading above $50,000 at 8:00 PM ET on July 25, 2025.

start_time.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the market starts

end_time.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the market ends

total.description: Total number of markets matching the filters

has_more.description: Whether there are more markets available

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters or validation errors

message.example: search must be at least 2 characters long

value.message: search must be at least 2 characters long
search parameter cannot be used with other filter parameters
limit must be a number between 1 and 100
offset must be a non-negative number

get.description: Fetches Kalshi market data with optional filtering by market ticker, event ticker, status, and volume. Returns markets with details including pricing, volume, and status information.

parameters.name: market_ticker
parameters.description: Filter markets by market ticker(s). Can provide multiple values.

parameters.name: event_ticker
parameters.description: Filter markets by event ticker(s). Can provide multiple values.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter markets by status (whether they're open or closed)

parameters.name: min_volume
parameters.description: Filter markets with total trading volume greater than or equal to this amount (in cents)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of markets to return (1-100). Default: 10.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of markets to skip for pagination

title.example: Will a representative of the Democratic party win the NYC Mayor race in 2025?

start_time.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the market opens

end_time.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the market is scheduled to end

close_time.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the market actually resolves/closes (may be before end_time if market finishes early, null if not yet closed)

total.description: Total number of markets matching the filters

has_more.description: Whether there are more markets available

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters or validation errors

message.example: limit must be a number between 1 and 100

get.description: Fetches historical orderbook snapshots for a specific Kalshi market (ticker) over a specified time range. Returns snapshots of the order book including yes/no bids and asks with prices in both cents and dollars. All timestamps are in milliseconds. Orderbook data has history starting from October 29th, 2025.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: The Kalshi market ticker

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of snapshots to return (default: 100, max: 500)

snapshots.description: Array of orderbook snapshots at different points in time

yes.description: Yes side orders with prices in cents

no.description: No side orders with prices in cents

yes_dollars.description: Yes side orders with prices in dollars

no_dollars.description: No side orders with prices in dollars

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the snapshot in milliseconds

has_more.description: Whether there are more snapshots available

message.example: ticker, start_time, and end_time are required

get.description: Fetches activity data for a specific user with optional filtering by market, condition, and time range. Returns trading activity including `MERGES`, `SPLITS`, and `REDEEMS`.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User wallet address to fetch activity for

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Filter activity from this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: Filter activity until this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

parameters.name: market_slug
parameters.description: Filter activity by market slug

parameters.name: condition_id
parameters.description: Filter activity by condition ID

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of activities to return (1-1000)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of activities to skip for pagination

shares.description: Raw number of shares (from the blockchain)

shares_normalized.description: Number of shares normalized (raw divided by 1000000)

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp in seconds when the activity occurred

count.description: Total number of activities matching the filters

has_more.description: Whether there are more activities available

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters or validation errors

value.message: start_time must be a valid Unix timestamp
end_time must be a valid Unix timestamp
start_time must be less than end_time
limit must be a number between 1 and 1000
offset must be a non-negative number
Only one of market_slug or condition_id can be provided
